bullets: Designed and drafted BIW fixtures for 7+ automotive OEMs using Autodesk Inventor and SolidWorks, aligned with ASME Y14.5, SAE, and NAAMS standards, including BOMs.
Delivered 2D/3D drawing packages via Teamcenter with <2% error rate across 100+ assemblies.
Standardized drawing templates and dimensioning protocols, reducing design errors by ~95% and improving peer-review efficiency by ~30%.
Modeled complex surfaces and assemblies in SolidWorks for prototype vehicle components contributing to an R&D flying car initiative.
Managed BOMs in Teamcenter PLM to ensure traceability and avoid version mismatches across 7+ concurrent OEM projects.
Mentored and onboarded 3 junior designers, leading CAD upskilling sessions that increased team output by ~20%.
Created 3D fixture designs and conducted dimensional stack-up analysis in SolidWorks/Inventor to support pre-production validation.
Implemented GD&T and tolerance optimization to improve fit-up and manufacturability during early concept iterations.
Coordinated cross-functional design reviews to troubleshoot bottlenecks and accelerate design release timelines.
